content.webTitle: Marcus Rashford’s elevation was a hunch, says United’s Louis van Gaal

fields.headline: Marcus Rashford’s elevation was a hunch, says United’s Louis van Gaal
fields.bodyText: Louis van Gaal was unsure how Marcus Rashford would perform for Manchester United because the stand-in teenage striker had barely trained with the first team despite twice being on the bench in November. Rashford scored twice on his debut against Midtjylland and two more in the 3-2 win against Arsenal, yet he was given a chance only because of Anthony Martial’s injury in the warm-up before the Europa League match with the Danish side. “He was training with the second team,” Van Gaal said. “Sometimes he could play the part in 11-against-11 and then I saw him. You can see him with the second team but he was fast and playing on the right and left side. I put him in the striker’s position. You never know if a player can cope with the rhythm of your team. He did it very well. “The first time it is not so difficult because the player is so focused. Now the pressure shall rise for him because all the people shall look at him in another way. After four goals, the fans are expecting the fifth. But he has certain qualities. He can score in his way and that’s because he sniffs the situation in advance of other players.” Rashford is a beneficiary of Van Gaal’s decision not to buy a striker in January. “I have not bought a striker because of Wayne Rooney and Martial, because they could play in the striker position, and because Rooney is the captain he shall always play. I don’t buy a third striker, so he [Rashford] has the possibility. “He was on the bench at Watford and Leicester. He was having a very good period. He might have come in for the Watford match but we played another system and Memphis Depay and Jesse Lingard played very well. Because we have a small squad and no more than two players for one position, you can give an opportunity to a youngster.” Martial has a chance of being in contention for the visit of Watford on Wednesday night and Van Gaal would not be drawn on whether Rashford would retain his place. “You have to wait and see,” he said. “When I have choice enough, then I rotate. There’s no player in the English Premier League who can cope with the rhythm of matches. A player like Rooney could always cope but he is injured and not for the first time. So I have to rotate. I have Rooney, I have Martial, I have Rashford, I had Will Keane but Keane is injured and will be operated on. When I have more players, I will rotate.” Van Gaal dismissed suggestions Rooney needs surgery on a knee injury. “No he does not need an operation. He may be back in March,” the manager said. The three consecutive victories against Shrewsbury Town, Midtjylland and Arsenal have lifted the club. “I think the atmosphere is always the most important thing,” Van Gaal said. “If you go to work and it is a sad atmosphere you are not going to work with your eyes open. I made some changes to the rhythm of the day to raise the atmosphere. You have to win to raise the atmosphere. We have won three times so even the media are happy. It’s unbelievable.” March could be a decisive month for United. After Watford, they are at West Brom on Sunday before they travel to Liverpool in the Europa League, face West Ham United in the FA Cup, host Liverpool in the return leg and then head to Manchester City for the derby. “Now we are coming into the decisive moments of the competition in the league and the FA Cup,” Van Gaal said. “It is important, especially from us, because we have lost too many unnecessary points. We are six behind Manchester City [fourth] and seven behind Arsenal. That is too much, so we have to win.”
